Secure.definition: to put beyond hazard of losing or not receiving [ the blessings of liberty " U.S. Constitution preamble"] 2 a
Secure.origin: [ the blessings of liberty " U.S. Constitution preamble"]

1.definition: to put beyond hazard of losing or not receiving [ the blessings of liberty "preamble"]

2 a.definition: to protect or make certain (as by lien) [make a just and equitable partition and the parties' respective interests ", 879 P.2d 607 (1994)"]

sub_terms.b: to give security for (as a loan) or otherwise assure the payment, performance, or execution of with security [the court imposed a lien on his property to the judgment]
sub_terms.c: to give or pledge security to (as a creditor)to cause to have security or a security interest [a creditorby a lien on real property]

2 a.secured: by a lien on real property]
